intro: Acrostichum vestitum, commonly known as the velvet fern, is a unique plant native to the wetlands of the southeastern United States. It is a member of the fern family (Polypodiaceae) and is characterized by its dense, hairy fronds that give it a soft, velvety appearance. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, forming dense mats that help stabilize the surrounding environment. Its fronds are usually dark green and can reach lengths of up to 30 centimeters. Acrostichum vestitum plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and contributing to soil stabilization.
